mdRecord.dcterms:title: Entrance loggia from Laurelton Hall, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tiffany, Louis Comfort (American painter and designer, 1848-1933) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Laurelton Hall fell into disrepair in the years after Tiffany's death, was sold in 1949, and burned in 1957. [work]

The majority of windows and other surviving architectural pieces were salvaged by Hugh McKean and Jeannette Genius McKean of the Charles Hosmer Morse Museum of American Art and shipped to Winter Park, Florida, after the fire. The loggia was given to the Metropolitan Museum of Art by the McKeans in 1978. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laurelton_Hall [work]
